WCHAR * TextCompoundItem::ExportInternalBuffer (  UINT  length  ) 
 

Allocates an internal buffer with the given length and returns a pointer to this buffer. Note that the pointer is invalid after invoking SetText, Insert, Replace or Remove. Having access directly to the buffer might be useful when using e. g. third-party predictive input-methods, which need a pointer to a buffer and manipulate this buffer itself.

BOOLEAN TextCompoundItem::IsStandaloneCharacter (  INT  index  )  const [virtual]
 

Tests if a character is rendered standalone in the text, or whether it is a diacritic that modifies preceding or following characters.

Parameters:
index the index of the character to be tested
Returns:
TRUE if the character is can rendered standalone, FALSE otherwise

void TextCompoundItem::SetDefaultColorHint (  BOOLEAN  use_default_color  )  [inline, protected]
 

Tells the text compound item whether it should use the theme dependant default text color or just use the current set color of the device context. This method can be used by derived classes which use TextCompoundItem::Draw.
